attributes.action: Allow the leader of UKIP to place a wreath at the cenotaph on remembrance day.
attributes.additional_details: The SNP, Liberal Democrats and others will be invited to pay their respects on remembrance Sunday yet represent many fewer people than UKIP. This is not a true reflection of democracy and a representative from UKIP should be offered the opportunity to attend.
attributes.background:
UKIP is the third largest party in the United Kingdom by number of votes and represents almost 4 million people; yet is denied a place at the cenotaph on remembrance day.

We request the government change the rules and invite a UKIP representative to lay a wreath along with other senior figures.
